entry.title: BLM OPEN HOUSE SERIES BEGINS THURSDAY

entry.title: EXTREME SNEAKER WAVE THREAT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
entry.summary: October 18, 2023 3:50 a.m. A Beach Hazards Statement remains in effect through Wednesday afternoon for the south-central Oregon coast including parts of Douglas, Coos and Curry counties. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said an extreme threat of sneaker waves is expected. Forecasters said that waves can run up significantly farther on a beach...

entry.title: VOLUNTEERS STILL NEEDED FOR MAKE A DIFFERENCE DAY

entry.title: Oregon Health Authority launches interactive transportation injury dashboard
entry.summary: Oregon Health Authority announced a new interactive data dashboard to help track state, county and demographic trends in deaths and hospital visits related to a range of transportation-related injuries.

entry.title: Umpqua Valley Arts partners with Thrive Umpqua, Umpqua Public Transit District to showcase student art on bus stops

entry.title: Forest Bridges invites public to second meeting on active conservation management plan
entry.summary: Douglas County residents interested in contributing to a forest conservation management plan are encouraged to join Forest Bridges representatives at the Roseburg Public Library on Wednesday.
